body_html:
Yeah, putting all XLA dev headers in pip or non-pip is a great goal. Not sure about the binary XLA, maybe the others can speak to that.

Also, it indeed would be nice to have an "XLA test validation suite" that was built in a way that you didn't need to have a custom device specified in our code, so feature request noted :)
body_text:
Yeah, putting all XLA dev headers in pip or non-pip is a great goal.  Not sure about the binary XLA, maybe the others can speak to that.
Also, it indeed would be nice to have an "XLA test validation suite" that was built in a way that you didn't need to have a custom device specified in our code, so feature request noted :)
body:
Yeah, putting all XLA dev headers in pip or non-pip is a great goal.  Not sure about the binary XLA, maybe the others can speak to that.

Also, it indeed would be nice to have an "XLA test validation suite" that was built in a way that you didn't need to have a custom device specified in our code, so feature request noted :)
